intro: Cynorkis rhomboglossa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
